meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of a nymph.
meanings.sent1: The forest was filled with nymphal creatures dancing under the moonlight.
meanings.sent2: The artist painted a beautiful nymphal scene with delicate colors and graceful figures.
meanings.sent3: The nymphal butterflies giggled as they fluttered around the garden.
meanings.sent4: Her nymphal beauty was like a rare flower blooming in a hidden meadow.
meanings.sent5: The nymphal music of the waterfall echoed through the valley, enchanting all who heard it.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to the stage of an insect between larval and adult forms.
meanings.sent1: The nymphal caterpillar was preparing to transform into a butterfly.
meanings.sent2: Scientists studied the nymphal development of beetles to understand their life cycle.
meanings.sent3: The nymphal insects threw a tiny graduation party to celebrate becoming adults.
meanings.sent4: The nymphal stage of the dragonfly symbolized a period of growth and change.
meanings.sent5: The nymphal exoskeleton of the cicada split open, revealing the emerging adult insect.
